Articles.Content:
Boy I'm a knucklehead. I can't believe I fat-fingered "$" instead of "@". I guess that's what I get for typing with mittens. And yes, hotrockets was also modifying ionengine. Good call, sebi!

Thanks again everyone. Everything is working as intended now.

Hello, someone commented in my thread I shouldn't leave a copy of module manager in my mod folder but instead place it in the gamedata folder. I liked it my way, nice and simple, saves me from having to write install instructions for CKAN.

In first post says multiple copies are "okay", but does it really matter in the intermediate size scheme of things?

@PrivateFlip, if you really need ModuleManager (and nearly everyone does ), the have just a "depends" section in your .ckan file. That way, CKAN would take care of the correct installation location for you (without having to "write install instructions" )
It does since I ask people to install it there. CKAN has ModuleManger already in there (and updated in realtime since yesterday), so you can just add a depends.
Okay fine
In MM 2.5.8 will the "&" fix still be in there for CSS (Crowd Sourced Science)?
Sarbian: it's "will not process patches in these subdirectories"

Olympic1 : I don't remove fix when I make a new version

ObsessedWithKSP : I did it in the displayed message but not here. Fixed now

I accidentally installed the Module Manager with CKAN since its a depenency of Trajectories. Now I have the problem that whenever I start KSP manually (not over CKAN), all the mods are simply disabled or not loaded. And because Alt + F11 obviously can not work under Linux I have no way to access the Module Manager from within the game. So: how do I reenable my mods?

Ok, is 2.5.8 ready and able for download?

From the OP, tried to feed the cat but only got 2.5.6

am i missing somethig, or, am i in too much of a hurry?????

either way, ok... Time for a Bacon and peanut butter snackwich....

Sarbian, FYI

Regarding this update's title

I am ALWAYS and forever feeding cats around here!!!!!

Just sayin'

Any of you remember George Carlin???

And how he fed cats with "Baco's" and help from the family dog.???

Got too love dem kats...

both george carlin and felines are cool but to digress from cool things... is 2.5.8 ready for download or is it still 2.5.6 and you're just teasing?

edit : sorry, sorry, spoke before i started thinking : module manager is cool cos without it a modded ksp would not work, like at all.

Edited January 9, 2015 by Maars

I 'think' it is still cooking.....

I have not seen a download for it, as of now....

But, Sarbian will serve it up when its ready....

Cheers.

Ok, is 2.5.8 ready and able for download?

From the OP, tried to feed the cat but only got 2.5.6

am i missing somethig, or, am i in too much of a hurry?????

either way, ok... Time for a Bacon and peanut butter snackwich....

I suppose sarbian hasn't updated download links yet. Until then, you may use this link to download 2.5.8.
It's totally there, if you know how to look for it. Judging by everything, someone forgot to update the FP. It's not much of a problem, seeing that most people get this with mods.

Use this link:

https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModuleManager/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ModuleManager-2.5.8.zip

I accidentally installed the Module Manager with CKAN since its a depenency of Trajectories. Now I have the problem that whenever I start KSP manually (not over CKAN), all the mods are simply disabled or not loaded. And because Alt + F11 obviously can not work under Linux I have no way to access the Module Manager from within the game. So: how do I reenable my mods?

In Linux, ALT + F11 can be accessed via R-Shift + F11. I've not had any problems running KSP in Linux (I actually run KSP_64 "by hand", because... well, I'm too lazy to fix the Launch KSP setting in CKAN).

Do the mods load when you launch via CKAN? If so, what's the command CKAN is running? Is CKAN pointing to the same install of KSP that you're running by hand?
Cleopatra approves this update:

This is 'nice', but....

I am sure that Kerbals that live on Kerbin, which orbits Kerbol..... Must have KATS........

But, I may be wrong????

This is 'nice', but....

I am sure that Kerbals that live on Kerbin, which orbits Kerbol..... Must have KATS........

But, I may be wrong????

Kleopatra?

Klaudious, mayhaps.... or keaser, but spoke with a lisp.

enought...

LoL....

Judging by everything, someone forgot to update the FP.

Clearly. Blame the cats.

Clearly. Blame the cats.

I never do. Cats are right by definition. If the cats caused it, it was definitely the right thing to do.

I never do. Cats are right by definition. If the cats caused it, it was definitely the right thing to do.

QFT
